intro: Meibomia axillaris var. acutifolia, commonly known as the sharp-leaved meibomia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, twining stems and small, opposite leaves that are sharply pointed, giving it its common name. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, clustered in small umbels, and bloom during the rainy season. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
